qas.question: Who built the three forts on St. Barts?
What was the former name of Fort Oscar?
On what part of the island is Fort Oscar located on the far side of?
Most of the Forts in St. Barts are now all what?
In what year was Gustav Adolph built?
In what year was Gustav Adolph renamed Fort Oscar?

plausible_answers.text: ramparts, guardhouse, munitions depot, wood-burning oven and so forth

qas.question: What types of ruins are left at Fort Karl?
In what year was Fort Karl built?
What type of terrain was Fort Karl built on?

context: Among the notable structures in the town are the three forts built by <a0_0>the Swedes<a0_0/> for defense purposes. One of these forts, known as Fort Oscar (formerly <a1_0>Gustav Adolph<a1_0/>), which overlooks the sea is located on the far side of <a3_0>La Pointe<a3_0/>. However, the ruins have been replaced by a modern military building which now houses the local gendarmerie. The other fort known as Fort Karl now presents a very few ruins. The third fort built by the Swedes is the Fort Gustav, which is also seen in <a4_0>ruins<a4_0/> strewn around the weather station and the Light House. The fort built in <a2_0><b5_0><b6_0><b8_0>1787<b8_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/> over a <b9_0>hill slope<b9_0/> has ruins of <b7_0>ramparts, guardhouse, munitions depot, wood-burning oven and so forth<b7_0/>.
